alert.note: Alert for Central Columbia River Gorge (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 05 at 4:44AM PST until January 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 10 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Additional 1 to 4 inches this morning. Snow will increase in the afternoon, with 3 to 9 inches of snow expected tonight. Snow will transition to sleet and freezing rain later to night, then turn to all rain by late Thursday morning. Ice accumulations of a quarter to half of an inch. * WHERE...In Washington, Central Columbia River Gorge. In Oregon, Upper Hood River Valley and Central Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from noon today to 10 AM PST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon PST today. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel will be challenging at times.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Drivers should be prepared for icy or snow covered roads and very dangerous winter like driving conditions. Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
